organization.name: Davao Oriental State University
organization.type: state-funded research-based coeducational higher education institution
organization.about: The Davao Oriental State University is a state-funded research-based coeducational higher education institution in Mati City, Davao Oriental, Philippines.

location.address: Guang-guang, Dahican, City of Mati 8200, Davao Oriental, Philippines

visionMission.vision: A university of excellence, innovation and inclusion.
mission: To elevate knowledge generation, utilization and distribution.
To promote inclusive sustainable development through research-based higher quality education and technical-vocational skills.
To produce holistic, creative, and inclusive human resource responsive to global challenges while maintaining strong sense of nationhood.

mandate.statement: The University is mandated to provide academic programs in science and technology, agriculture, engineering, teacher education, and technical education, aligned with national, regional and local development goals.
objectives: Provide higher quality tertiary education characterized by cultural sensitivity and interdisciplinary approach.
Advance knowledge by research and community involvement achieving national recognition.
Support national and regional economic development agenda and directions.
Build strong ties within the region, the nation, and international partnerships.

qualityPolicy.statement: Davao Oriental State University is an institution sustained by quality education. It seeks to improve its Quality Management System to better serve students and communities.
commitments: Deliver quality education, research, extension, and progressive leadership.
Offer programs responsive to the Sustainable Development Goals.
Maintain a conducive environment through continuous development and modern facilities.
Comply with statutory and regulatory requirements.
Implement improvements using Risk Management and 5S.
Transfer knowledge and QMS expertise to other institutions.

conversionProcess.description: The university conversion was a collaborative effort involving multiple stakeholders and rigorous compliance with CHED standards

history.narrative: Davao Oriental State University (DOrSU) was established through Republic Act No. 11033, signed into law by President Rodrigo Roa Duterte at the Malacañang Palace on May 28, 2018. The University's rich history dates back to 1972 as a Mati Community College (MCC) founded by the then Mati Municipal Mayor Thelma Z. Almario with the Founding Dean of College, Dr. Leopoldo Bravo. With the goal to expand its operation and provide more opportunities to the residents of Davao Oriental and its neighboring provinces, it was converted into Davao Oriental State College of Science and Technology (DOSCST), established on December 13, 1989, by virtue of Republic Act No. 6807. In 1991, the College transferred to its present 10-hectare campus in Guang-Guang, Dahican, City of Mati, donated by the heirs of Don Jose Corro Martinez. The University expanded services across the Province of Davao Oriental with campuses established in San Isidro (November 1997), Cateel (June 1999), and Banaybanay (June 2015).

heritage.description: DOrSU is an academic steward of world-renowned natural heritage sites

sites.name: Mt. Hamiguitan Range Wildlife Sanctuary (MHRWS)
sites.significance: The only World Heritage Site in Mindanao inscribed by UNESCO

sites.name: Pujada Bay
sites.designation: Most Beautiful Bays of the World (MBBW)
sites.significance: Listed among the world's most beautiful bays

sites.name: Mayo Bay
sites.designation: Most Beautiful Bays of the World (MBBW)
sites.significance: Listed among the world's most beautiful bays

history.currentMission: The University remains true to its vision of promoting excellence, innovation, and inclusion as a premier institution in the easternmost part of the Philippines. It forefronts the advancement of sustainable development, regenerative science, and future-proofing in all academic disciplines. DOrSU embodies the hopes and aspirations of its founders, leaders, constituents, and the local and indigenous communities that it serves.
charterMandates: Offering undergraduate, graduate, and postgraduate programs
history.source: Written by Jhonnel P. Villegas, October 13, 2021

president.name: Dr. Roy G. Ponce
president.title: President

degrees.degree: Doctor of Education in Evaluation Capacity Building

achievements: Two-time alumnus of The University of Melbourne, Australia
Instrumental in the successful inscription of Mt. Hamiguitan as a UNESCO World Heritage Site
Established the Subangan Museum and Mt. Hamiguitan Museum in Davao Oriental
Honored by discovery of weevil species Metapocyrtus poncei named after him
Co-founded Happy Fish Kids (HFK) afterschool care project
Recipient of prestigious Australian Alumni Excellence Awards in 2017
Institutionalized Happy Forest Kids and Happy Farm Kids programs as offshoots of HFK
Brainchild and thought-leader in positioning DOrSU as a regenerative futures university

verse1: Precious Gem of Davao Orient seas, Davao Oriental State University
Pillar of success, Fountain of wisdom and creativity
In every battle together we will fight, Thy army pledge it's loyalty
With virtue of love to God and humanity, Let's stand with pride and dignity
chorus: Raise your banner proud and mighty
Keep a heart that nurtures life
Davao Oriental State University Go forth bearer of truth and integrity
Emblem the seal in our hearts and minds
Lit our lamp with light and warmth,
verse2: Precious gem of Davao Orient Seas, Davao Oriental State University
We unite to include everyone, all praise and salute to thee
Your light shall shine over hills and plains, And every ocean strand
For the Divine hath favored thy greatness, together we will stand
finalChorus: Raise your banner proud and mighty
Keep a heart that nurtures life
Move forward in every fight (transpose to F)
Go forth bearer of truth and integrity
Emblem the seal in our hearts and minds
Lit our lamp with light and warmth,

suastStatistics.testName: State University Aptitude and Scholarship Test
suastStatistics.description: The State University Aptitude and Scholarship Test (SUAST) is the entrance examination for Davao Oriental State University. It assesses the aptitude and readiness of applicants for admission to the university's various programs.
suastStatistics.notes: The passing rate represents the percentage of applicants who passed the SUAST examination. The number of enrolled applicants may exceed the number of passers as it includes students who may have been admitted through other pathways or special programs.

developers.notes: Developed the DOrSU Assistant AI and dataset structure as part of their capstone project.

usc.description: The Davao Oriental State University Student Council, the highest student governing body of Davao Oriental State University, one of the biggest state universities in Region 11 that has the highest number of student population on the entire region. The University Student Council (USC) of Davao Oriental State University (DOrSU) is a constitution that governs the whole student population of DOrSU which includes the students of the extension campuses as well. This organization aspires to bestow programs, projects, and activities that are aligned with the University's vision of Excellence, Innovation, and Inclusion.
usc.mission: This USC seeks to uphold and promote the rights and general welfare of all the DOrSU students. It also aspires to be an active forum of students' ideas and sentiments, and instill consciousness among the students. The organization strives to enhance social awareness and promote national consciousness among students, and develop responsible studentry, which will reinforce service-oriented education. And aspires to cultivate potentials, skills, and knowledge among the studentry for the betterment of the community.
beliefs: That access to education shall be given to everyone
That education should develop man's physical, mental, social, cultural, political, and spiritual potentials to the fullest, in order to realize a human and humane existence for all
That education should enhance critical and analytical thinking and sound judgment, free from superstitious and myths belief
That the University Student Council's programs, projects and activities should be aligned with the University's vision of Excellence, Innovation, and Inclusion
objectives: Defend and promote the rights and general welfare of DOrSU students
Serve as an active forum to student's ideas and sentiments
Instill consciousness among the ranks of students

Promote the ideals of the University in realizing that the development of human resources in terms of ensuring well-rounded intellectual, social, cultural, physical, political and spiritual development of every students
Enhance social awareness and promote national consciousness among students
Cooperate and establish linkages with various sectors of the society in the pursuit of common interest particularly in the formation of just and humane society
Develop responsible studentry, who will uphold service-oriented education
Support educational reforms along nationalistic, humanistic and scientific methods, for the development of human potential; to meet the social realities and to exercise academic freedom
Develop a responsive studentry who put educational opportunity to optional use and look after the unity and welfare of the whole studentry and the people
Be an effective voice which can truly realize the plans and aspirations of the students
Develop potentials, skills and knowledge among the studentry for the betterment of the community
Coordinate with the OSA in the overall planning for the development of the institution

logoSymbolism.universityStatue: Symbolic of the University's mission to develop holistic, creative and inclusive human resource who are responsive and resilient to global challenges

angSidlakan.tagline: Your Voice. Your Vanguard. Your Truth.
angSidlakan.description: Davao Oriental State University upholds the right to freedom of expression and the journalistic views of its students, and it is embodied in the University's student publication, Ang Sidlakan.
angSidlakan.about: Ang Sidlakan, attributed to its acronym 'AS' is the Official Student Publication of Davao Oriental State University. It bears its official tagline, 'Your Voice. Your Vanguard. Your Truth.' The AS is in service to the general needs of the student body and is always abiding by the ethics of responsible journalism. Its primary duty is to publish articles with a wide range of topics, stemming from news and events within the campus, local, national, or even international level that directly impact the students and the public in general.
angSidlakan.membership: The members of Ang Sidlakan are bonafide students of DOrSU, and are carefully selected in accordance to their academic standing and capabilities. Each member possesses exemplary wit and communication skills, a pleasing personality, and the passion and commitment to be of service to the students, the university, and the people. AS values fairness and equality within the publication, while carrying their duty to amplify the voices of every Tata, despite diversities in their age, gender, religion, and cultural backgrounds.
objectives: To publish at least one issue per semester and special issues if needed
Establish and maintain an online presence to serve the student body in the digital medium
To serve general interest of the DOrSU studentry in the main and extension campuses
To serve as a medium of truth for campus, local, national, and international issues
To continually equip its staff with high caliber skills in writing, photojournalism, layout, and cartooning

leadership.structure: Headed by a President and supervised by a faculty as its Adviser

catalyst.purpose: A special student organization under the Student Services Division of Davao Oriental State University that caters to the needs and interests of the graduating students. Its major goal is to provide the senior students with a repository of their memories – a yearbook.
catalyst.vision: The Catalyst envisions an organization to provide quality services to its clientele particularly to the DOrSU graduating students in terms of yearbook production and to foster good and harmonious relationships among the members in the organizations. It upholds the vision of the institution in creating a culture of excellence, innovation and inclusion.
servicesOffered: Collection of graduates pictures and yearbook
Releasing of graduate pictures and yearbook
Client reception through telephone/mail and Facebook inquiry
University Service and Community Outreach Activities

OSCD.fullName: Office of Student Counseling and Development
OSCD.description: Office of Student Counseling and Development formerly GCTC is here to help you with your academic, personal, social and career needs. The Office is committed to help you attain your full academic potential, foster responsible independence and develop a sense of self-worth as you strive to identify and clarify your personal values and goals, through a supportive counseling relationship.
OSCD.servicesOverview: OSCD offers Counseling services, Testing service, Orientation services, Placement service, Individual Inventory service and Information service.

servicesOffered.name: Individual Inventory Service
servicesOffered.description: This service keeps the individual student records and reports to be utilized for counseling, planning the student's educational and vocational programs and for administrative purposes.

servicesOffered.name: Counseling Service
servicesOffered.description: This service aims to assist DOrSU community, especially the student body lay a permanent foundation for making sound mature decision in their pursuit for self-fulfillment and self-actualization. This can be individual counseling (one-on-one with the guidance counselor) or group guidance as in group dynamics enrichment sessions, for a group discussion & group process.

servicesOffered.name: Orientation Service
servicesOffered.description: It acquaints and help you adjust with the school environment and situation.

servicesOffered.name: Information Service
servicesOffered.description: This service is designed to promote environmental awareness. It aims to promote valuable information to inspire the students and give motivation for their success.

servicesOffered.name: Testing Service
servicesOffered.description: Testing helps individuals understand their strengths and weaknesses so they can better realize their potential. It can help appraise the students mental ability, emotional intelligence, personality profile, adjustment inventory, and self-report measure.

servicesOffered.name: Placement Service
servicesOffered.description: A Placement Service is a continuous program which helps determine the manner to assign a student based on his/her personal and social adjustment. Students are placed in classes and programs suitable to their needs, interests and abilities. Moreover, they also receive appropriate training and preparation to ensure them that they will be prepared to land for a stable job after graduation.

servicesOffered.name: Follow-up Service
servicesOffered.description: A continuous monitoring program designed to evaluate the effectiveness of the intervention procedures in relation to student progress and adjustments. This service is undertaken as systematic evaluation of whether the guidance service in particular and the educational program in general have satisfied the needs of students.

servicesOffered.name: Prevention and Wellness
servicesOffered.description: A service offered to the clientele aiming to encourage lifestyle change for healthy living and keep something from happening or worsen such as psychosocial, emotional and intellectual problems.

OSA.purpose: The main purpose of Student Affairs' work is to support student learning and personal growth. We do this by providing important services, being advocates for students, helping students adjust socially, and providing a curriculum for personal growth and learning through student involvement in co-curricular activities. The most desirable approach to the support of learning and personal growth is in partnership with the faculty. This partnership can take on many forms including service-learning opportunities, compensatory educational programs, and student-faculty interaction outside the classroom, especially in student organizations that are academically aligned.
roles: Helping student adjust to the campus
Being educators in partnership with the faculty
servicesOffered: Processing and Issuance of Identification Card
Application and Issuance of Certification of Moral Character, etc.

OHWS.fullName: Office of Health and Wellness Services
OHWS.description: The Health Services Unit (HSU) is an arm of the office of the Director of Student Services that provides health services to the DOrSU constituents within the framework of a clinic-out-patient setting and referral system-as the need arises. This involves consultation, treatment of health related problems and referrals.
OHWS.servicePledge: We are committed to deliver quality health care and friendly environment.
objectives: To promote primary health care to all clients
To provide initial management of common illnesses
To promote safety culture in the college and among the clients through active participation in emergency response and disaster prevention

procedure: Present School Identification Card
For old client, locate the outpatient record/dental record
For new client, fill up the outpatient/center record
Ask and record the complaint of the clients
Take the vital signs (Blood Pressure, Temperature, Height and Weight)
servicesOffered.personnel: Health Services Unit Personnel and Physician

procedure: Refer to the school physician/dentist for consultation and perform medical/dental procedures
Give prescribed medicine and correct dosage with proper health teaching
Give over the counter medicine (if necessary) or independent nursing intervention as needed
Refer to specialized medical practitioner or higher facility
servicesOffered.personnel: Physician assisted by Health Services Unit Personnel

procedure: For old students, fill-up the updated physical examination records
For new students, physical examination record
Take the vital sign (Blood Pressure, Temperature, Height and Weight)
Assessment and interview of the laboratory results with medical certification
Needs follow-up if YES to come back for consultation. If NO, keep the file
Take client vital signs
Apply first aid
Refer to school physician/give OTC meds or prescribed meds if necessary
Health Services Unit Personnel fills up the emergency care record form
Health Services Unit Personnel informs client's relatives/parents/instructor
Reassessment of clients
Call EMS/CDRRMO
Discharge the client with complete health teaching and home instructions

library.fullName: University Learning and Information Resource Center
library.about: The Davao Oriental State University (DOrSU) Library serves as the intellectual heart of our campus, providing essential resources and services to support the academic and research needs of students, faculty, and staff. Established alongside the university, our library has grown into a comprehensive knowledge hub that combines traditional library services with innovative digital resources.

hours.physicalLibrary: 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, Monday to Saturday
hours.onlineServices: 5:00 PM to 9:00 PM, Monday to Friday

library.vision: A World-Class Learning and Information Center
library.mission: To fulfill the vision of excellence, innovation, and inclusion of DOrSU, the university library shall be an inclusive learning information resource center that endeavors to: contribute to quality academic and research programs of the university; provide cutting-edge innovation in library services; and respond to the information needs of diverse constituents of instruction, research, extension, and production.
library.collections: Our library houses a diverse collection of resources, including books, journals, magazines, theses, dissertations, and digital materials. We continuously update our collection to ensure that our resources remain relevant and responsive to the evolving needs of our academic community. Our specialized collections cover a wide range of disciplines reflecting the university's academic programs.

clientEducationServices.description: The client education section is responsible for the timely, appropriate, and relevant services to educate all users about what the Library can offer for their instruction, research, extension, and other information needs. The section is also responsible for reaching out to the information community about the latest information resources and how they can benefit from the same.

programs.name: Information Literacy
programs.description: The Library promotes its resources and services. One of these is library instruction which is conducted every opening of classes. This is an enhanced instruction using recorded videos, policy guides, and other handouts. The instruction also includes how to use the collection of online databases and electronic resources. There are also established programs such as 'Read Every Day, Lead a Better Life' and 'ineed, ivalue, ILOVEMYLIBRARY' that help educate users on the value of reading and the preservation of resources.

programs.name: Marketing
programs.description: This service is one of the most relevant components of library information delivery. Librarians shall create persuasive efforts in disseminating information, so that clients or library clients will be motivated to take advantage of library services and develop skills that will improve learning and research abilities in support to their academic requirements. The Client Education and Information Services supervisor monitors the operation.

programs.name: Library Orientation
programs.description: Educating new students on library operations and services is a yearly activity conducted by librarians. The schedule usually happens in the first semester of every school year. New students are required to attend this activity to acquire information on library rules, regulations, policies, and services. Hence, to get the maximum attendance of the new students, cooperation with the deans and program heads of the different institutes/faculties is necessary.

clientInformationServices.description: The client information section is complementary to the role and functions of the client education service. After clients are informed about the resources and services of the library, the section provides them with their much-needed information resources. The majority of these resources can be borrowed for home use depending on their type: Some are available only at the library; while others are accessed via the internet.

sections.name: General Education and References Section
sections.description: Contains supplemental reading materials to textbooks used in different courses. It also contains books (e.g. encyclopedia, almanac, miscellanies, atlases, yearbooks, dictionaries, etc.) and materials to be consulted only for specific or brief inquiries which are available for room use only.

sections.name: Professional Collection
sections.description: Includes professional reading materials to support the curricular needs of all the programs offered in the institution.
subcategories: Agriculture and Life Sciences (Agriculture, Biology, Environmental Science, DevCom)

sections.name: Reserve Section
sections.description: Includes single copies of textbooks to support different courses are put on reserve.

sections.name: Filipiniana and Memorabilia
sections.description: Include books, manuscripts and other similar publications about the Philippines regardless of author and place of publication which are strictly for room use only.

sections.name: Serials
sections.description: House publication like journals, magazines, and periodicals. It also includes government publications and vertical filing. All of these materials are strictly for room use only.

sections.name: Special Collection
sections.description: Houses books and private organization. It includes these collections: Atty. Piit Special Collection, Provincial DILG-KRN, American Corner, PSA/NSO, and so on, are deposited in the Special Collections sections.

sections.name: Audio-Visual and Multimedia Materials
sections.description: Offer services that are for instruction-related services. A faculty will make the reservation, which will be on a first-come, first-served basis. He/she shall facilitate the activity to ensure safety and protection of the facilities. Only the library collected titles and other audio-visual materials recommended by the faculty shall be allowed for viewing. A ten pesos (P10.00) per hour fee shall be collected as an incidental fee to augment the budget for the repair of damaged resources and/or facilities of their or purchase of their replacements. The AVR/MM materials and equipment are strictly for room use only.

sections.name: Archives and Records
sections.description: Houses both published and unpublished manuscripts submitted by graduate and undergraduate students as well as academic researchers. It also houses other collections of greater value. All library records of perpetual importance can also be found in this section. These materials are strictly for room use only.

sections.name: Digital Document Delivery
sections.description: The Digital Document Delivery Service (DDD) is an online or electronic version of circulation service. The Materials in print are digitized to allow online research on a view only capacity. The digitized titles are emailed to clients upon request. Inquiries relevant to this service may be sent to the DOrSU library page.

onlineServices.name: Ask-A-Librarian
onlineServices.description: An activity in which a patron can ask possible resources available online, from any downloaded databases. It provides links to reliable open access sites.

onlineServices.name: Ask-A-Patron
onlineServices.description: Any library staff will find ways to reach out to library patrons to gather their concerns and research needs. Personal data shall be dealt with utmost confidentiality, adhering to the Data Privacy Act of 2018.

onlineServices.name: Photo Request Service
onlineServices.description: Requests for taking photos of limited book pages may be made. This can be accomplished by sending a private message to our Facebook, sending a request via email, or texting via SMS.

IRO.description: The Davao Oriental State University's International Relations Office (IRO) is an Administrative Unit under the Office of the President and serves as the university's channel in organizing innovative and inclusive programs essential in expanding its transnational experience for its stakeholders towards global competitiveness and development; strengthen its global linkages to form a global representative network that will carry DOrSU in the international academic map.
IRO.purpose: Anchored to the university's vision to become a university of excellence, innovation and inclusion, the International Relations Office shall take the initiative in establishing an engaging international relationship and explore opportunities for faculty members, students, and non-teaching staff towards cross border mobility and internationalization.
services: Initiate and explore linkages with foreign organizations, networks, and associations for prospective programs and projects
Promote good international public relations and goodwill for the University
Plan and implement capability-building activities promoting efforts for international recognition for the University
Coordinate, monitor, and assess international recognition efforts in the University
Represent the University in international meetings when required
Perform other duties and responsibilities that may be assigned by the University President

notableAchievementsAndPartnerships.institution: Universiti Malaysia Terengganu, Faculty of Fisheries and Food Science

CGAD.vision: A premier Center for Gender and Development in the Asia Pacific that emulates inclusion through gender-responsive policies, programs and services leading towards gender equality and women's empowerment.
CGAD.mission: The Center for Gender and Development is committed to uphold gender equality and women's empowerment in all spheres of public and private life by implementing various gender mainstreaming strategies that cuts across instruction, research, and community extension.
goals: Sustainable and gender responsive instruction, research, community development and involvement
Gender equity and equality among the DORSU constituents
Sustainable GAD responsive partnership and cooperation among stakeholders
Advance a gender-responsive policy environment in the University
bannerPrograms: Gender-Responsive Research and Resource Collection Program
Gender-Responsive Extension and Community Engagement Program
Gender-Responsive Learning and Working Environments Program
partnerships: The International Institute of Knowledge Management
Department of Education – City of Mati
Department of the Interior and Local Government
Local Government Unit of San Isidro, Davao Oriental

IPTBM.fullName: Intellectual Property and Technology Business Management
IPTBM.description: The Davao Oriental State University formerly known as the Davao Oriental State College of Science and Technology (DOSCST) inaugurated its Intellectual Property and Technology Business Management (IP-TBM) Office through a Marker Unveiling Ceremony on May 18, 2021.
IPTBM.history: The ceremony signifies the establishment of an institutionalized IP-TBM office in the College as part of its organizational structure. This office, led by DOrSU/DOSCST-IPTBM Project Staff Mr. Venson B. Sarita, will have a separate identity and will be in charge of Intellectual Property Management which will include copyright, patents, utility models, and trademarks for future research and inventions.
guestsAtInauguration: SUSTAIN-IPTMB Project Leader and Director of USeP KTTD Engr. Filmann T. Simpao
DOST XI Provincial Director Ms. Sharon Alegado
SUC President III Dr. Roy G. Ponce
VP for RDE Dr. Wilanfranco Tayone
IPTBM.achievement: DOrSU is considered the top institution in the Davao Region for the most applications in IP models. This accolade is a clear manifestation of the College's commitment to being a top-notch hub for research and development in the country.

annualAccomplishmentReports.description: DOrSU's Annual Accomplishment Reports document the university's achievements, initiatives, and progress across instruction, research, extension, and administration for each academic year.
annualAccomplishmentReports.access: All reports are publicly accessible via the DOrSU official website and contain comprehensive information about the university's performance and achievements.
